DataElement.preferredName: EPIC-26 - Pads or Adult Diapers per Day Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation in the past 4 weeks how many pads or adult diapers per day did they use to control leakage, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain EPIC-26 - Pads or Adult Diapers per Day Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form (EPIC-26) How many pads or adult diapers per day did you usually use to control leakage during the last 4 weeks?

ValueDomain.preferredName: EPIC Daily Pad Use 4 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard related to the use per day of adult diapers or pads to control urine leakage associated with the EPIC measure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used one absorbent pad per day.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used one absorbent pad per day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used two absorbent pads per day.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used two absorbent pads per day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used three absorbent pads per day.

Concepts.longName: Three or More Pads per Day
Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used three or more absorbent pads per day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual did not use any absorbent pads per day.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual did not use any absorbent pads per day.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Alliance and NRG studies in Rave. mc 12/23/15

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 5105634 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
